entry.title: ABAP
entry.content:
Hello everyone, please help me with the following question:

You have a superclass super1 and a subclass sub1 of super1. Each class has an instance constructor and a static constructor. The first statement of the program created an instance of sub1. In which sequence will the constructors be executed?

a. Class constructor of super1

b. Instance constructor of sub1 c. Instance constructor of super 1 d. Class constructor of sub1.

entry.title: SAP ESS Weekly Calender Days are not displayed in Correct Order
entry.content:
The display of the weekly calendar is incorrect when making time booking corrections in ESS. Tuesday always appear at the end of the week (after Sunday). I have tried adjusting the view settings, but have not been able to solve the problem yet. It is only for one employee and for everyone else it is displaying correctly. I also delete all the cookies and cache memory but no solution yet. Can anyone help me to fix this issue. 

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Optimizing SAP On-Premises to Azure SQL Server Data Pipeline for Scalability
entry.content:
I have configured a data pipeline to facilitate real-time or near-real-time data transfer between an SAP on-premises server and Azure SQL Server.

Current Setup:
Established a VPN connection to securely access the SAP on-premises database, enabling authentication-based access.
Implemented an ELT pipeline to load data into Azure SQL Server efficiently.
Additionally, configured an OData connection to extract and transfer data.
Currently, the setup functions well. However, I am concerned about its scalability as data traffic increases in the future. To ensure seamless performance, I am looking for ways to optimize the existing process.

I would appreciate insights, recommendations, and discussions on improving this setup for better efficiency and handling higher data volumes. Open to exploring alternative connectivity and data transfer approaches.

Looking forward to expert suggestions from the SAP Community!

Regards;
Prashant Marathe

entry.title: What's the future of SAP technical consultant?
entry.content:
With the introduction of next-generation technologies like SAP BTP, ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), SAP Build (LCNC tools), and SAP Joule (AI), it's clear that SAP is moving towards a clean core, cloud-based future.

However, in reality, many organizations are still operating on legacy ABAP systems, and real-world adoption of these new tools remains limited. With the end of ECC support by 2027, this gap raises some concerns.

❓Key Questions:

1. What is the realistic future for SAP technical consultants in this evolving landscape?

2. Is it practical to invest time in RAP, BTP, or AI tools, given the current slow adoption?

3. Are any real projects or clients actively implementing these technologies?

Would appreciate insights from those currently working on RAP or BTP-based projects or involved in modern SAP implementations.

Thank you!

entry.title: Clarification about storage path- GOS_ATTACHMENT_LIST_POPUP
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

Recently, I used the function module GOS_ATTACHMENT_LIST_POPUP to create and display attachments for one of the purchasing transactions (ME11/ME12). The functionality works as expected.

However, considering the high frequency of attachments created by users in these transactions and the fact that we are not using a content server, there is a concern about storage usage, since all attachments are stored directly in the SAP Office.

I would like to know:

  1. Where exactly are these attachments stored in the SAP database/ SAPoffice.

  2. I have already explored some important tables such as:

  • SRGBTBREL
  • SOOD
  • SOFM
  • SOC3
  • SOFFCONT1

  1. I need to understand how these tables are linked and how I can trace and retrieve the binary content of attachments from them.

  2. Also, I would like to confirm which table stores the actual binary content.

  3. Finally, I need to determine the size of the table that holds the binary data to assess the storage impact.

Any insights on the linkage and storage structure of GOS attachments in a non-content server setup would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks for your time!

entry.title: create rebate agreement VBO1 in SD module which can get quantity and discount slab dynamically
entry.content:
• 1) GROUP for this group There are three companies in this group with three different names.

SLAB

DISC. RS.

+50

600

+200

800

+500

1000

+800

1150

+1200

1300

+1800

1400

  •  Quantity-Linked Discount for All on a Monthly Basis (Monthly Spot Qty Discount):

SOLD TO PARTY

QTY

GROUP SLAB ON TOTAL QTY

DYNAMICALLY APPLIED SLAB

COMPANY -1

229.365

1300

800

COMPANY -2

741.825

1300

1000

COMPANY -3

441.135

1300

800

TOTAL GROUP QTY

1412.325

 

 

 

We have to explore the desired solution so as to create a new condition like “s.org/material or product hierarchy/sold to party (payer) customer group code (NPL GROUP)/payer.”

Where “payer” will decide total D.I. quantity (discount quantity is decided based on D.I. DATE) from the “from” and “to” dates, and “sold to party (payer) customer group code (NPL GROUP)” will decide total group quantity for discount slab.

2) Customer’s Discount (consumer spot discount): for those customers who lift material through one or more different dealers.

QTY. SLAB

DISC. RS/PMT

+750

300

+2000

400

+4000

500

+5500

600

 

DEALER -1

QTY

GROUP SLAB ON TOTAL QTY

DYNAMICALLY APPLIED SLAB

CUSTOMER-XYZ

278.145

300

0

DEALER-2

 

 

 

CUSTOMER-XYZ

1259.370

300

300

TOTAL

1537.515

 

 

 

For this we will have to create a condition like “s.org/material or product hierarchy/ship to party customer group code/payer.”

Where “payer” will decide total D.I. quantity (discount quantity is decided based on D.I. DATE) on from and to date, and “ship to party customer group code (NPL GROUP)” quantity will decide discount slab. 

 

SECOND SCENARIO

1. CONSUMER CONTRACT DISCOUNT

S.ORG/MATERIAL OR PRODUCT HEIRARCHY/SALES TERMS/CONTRACT QTY/SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE OR CONSUMER CODE

CONTRACT QTY SHOULD DECIDE PERCENTAGE OF LIFTED QTY BASED ON SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE QUANTITY AND PICK DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON PERCENTAGE.

SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE OR CODE WILL DECIDE REAL LIFTING QUANTITY.

 
  1. DEALER CONTRACTUAL DISCOUNT BASED ON BASIC PRICE

S.ORG/MATERIAL OR PRODUCT HEIRARCHY/SALES TERMS/BASIC PRICE/ CONTRACT QTY/PAYER GROUP CODE OR CODE

BASIC PRICE WILL DECIDE DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON BASIC PRICE DISCOUNT SLAB.

CONTRACT QTY SHOULD DECIDE PERCENTAGE OF LIFTED QTY BASED ON PAYER GROUP CODE QUANTITY AND PICK DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON PERCENTAGE IN REFERENCE WITH THE ABOVE BASIC PRICE.

PAYER GROUP CODE OR CODE WILL DECIDE REAL LIFTING QUANTITY.

Or we can create a different criterion condition for the individual and then club with multiple conditions at the agreement level sequentially.

entry.title: Using Joule Studio Custom AI Agents to Query Case Status from ServiceNow
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm exploring a use-case with custom Joule Agents, and wondering if anyone has tried something similar yet with ServiceNow (preferably) or other case systems?

The scenario I'm after: An employee is logged into SuccessFactors and asks Joule something like “What’s the status of my case (ref: xxxxx)?”

The aim is for Joule to retrieve the case details from ServiceNow and return the update directly in the Joule chat, without the employee needing to switch systems (steps listed below).

  1. Use the employee's current SuccessFactors user context
  2. Call ServiceNow to get case/ticket status/details for that employee only
  3. Return the result directly in the Joule chat
  4. Uses the SAP Integration Suite or ServiceNow REST API exposed as a Skill

We already use the ServiceNow IntegrationHub SuccessFactors Spoke, and we maintain a shared user identifier between the systems, so user identity matching is already in place. I’d be interested to know if this can be leveraged alongside the Joule Agent.

Also, which approach would be recommended:

  • Joule → SAP Integration Suite → ServiceNow
  • Joule → ServiceNow REST API directly as a skill

Regards,

Dauied Medhanie

entry.title: Unable to get Authorized object
entry.content:
Hi, 
I am using SAP B1.Can someone please help me with this, When I am trying to getting the session id from the Postman its giving me success response 



But when I am trying to do same thing with .net code its throwing the error 


Here is my code snippet as well

string endpoint = $"{baseURL.TrimEnd('/')}/{version.Trim('/')}/Login";

var payload = new
{
CompanyDB = "SBODemoUS",
UserName = "manager",
Password = "xxxxxxx"
};

string jsonContent = JsonConvert.SerializeObject(payload);
var handler = new HttpClientHandler
{
ServerCertificateCustomValidationCallback = (message, cert, chain, errors) => true
};

var httpclient = new HttpClient(handler);
var content = new StringContent(jsonContent, null, "application/json");
var response = await httpclient.PostAsync(endpoint, content);
if (!response.IsSuccessStatusCode)
{
var responseContent = await response.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
}


I also overserved that when I am trying to run the same code from .net core its working but when I am trying with .net 4.7 its throwing error.

entry.title: Overview of background job in the system
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Kindly advise with my situation here:

The system was migrated from legacy to s/4 Hana on premise 1709. But there is no documentation of background jobs present or created later in the system. I went through SAP notes and doc here and there but couldn't find a resolution.

I need an overview of all the background jobs present in our system, their logs and their purpose, if possible.
